Accessing keychain items or performing operations on keys that are protected by access control objects may block execution on the main thread. Perform these actions in the background, or use them in combination with the
and
attributes to manage user interactions.

abstract.text: Releases a Core Foundation object.
This is a synonym for `NULL`.
Secure the data your app manages, and control access to your app.
An opaque type that contains information about how a keychain item may be used.
Access control constants that dictate how a keychain item may be used.
Creates a new access control object with the specified protection type and flags.
Adds one or more items to a keychain.
Modifies items that match a search query.
Creates an asymmetric key pair.
A key with a value that’s an access control instance indicating access control settings for the item.
A key with a value that indicates when the keychain item is accessible.
A key whose value indicates a local authentication context to use.
A key whose value indicates whether the user is prompted for authentication.
Create an extra layer of security for your private keys.

doc://com.apple.security/documentation/S.title: Protecting keys with the Secure Enclave

abstract.text: Set the conditions under which an app can access a keychain item such as a password.
A reference to a CFAllocator object.
A reference to a CFError object.
An untyped "generic" reference to any Core Foundation object.
A pointer for accessing and manipulating data of a specific type.
A type for propagating an unmanaged object reference.
